sermons.title: 54 Principle 50 - Not Merely Listening
sermons.description: When we start reading the Bible based on our human wisdom we deny the faith and accuracy of Scripture. Without the guidance of the Holy Spirit men have been making up entire systems of beliefs with theological words that are used blasphemously and do not represent the truth nor the heart of God. We are then misled to believe that such humanistic doctrines carry â€œlife.â€ Life is not found in a theological system or interpretation; Life is found in Christ Jesus, surrendering to Him and allowing Him to live His Life through us. Thatâ€™s what it means to be â€œborn againâ€ or â€œborn of the Spirit.â€

sermons.title: 76 Chronological Bible Reading of Scriptures
sermons.description: There is a great need in the body of Christ for consistent reading of the Holy Scriptures in their entirety, book by book, chapter by chapter, verse by verse. In this case we are encouraging a chronological reading of the Scriptures. Most of the confusion is created when certain teachers, groups, or denominations take singular verses out of context and compare them with others. Though it is a good spiritual principle to compare spiritual truths with spiritual truths,1139 yet this must all be done in the larger context of Godâ€™s Word. Therefore we are encouraging all of Godâ€™s saints to have a consistent discipline of reading through the whole Scriptures once a year as a supplemental reading plan.

sermons.title: A Wake Up Call To Men In The Church
sermons.description: We are in desperate need of genuine leadership-broken, humble men-men who are not afraid to admit that they need God; men who are more worried about prayer than about status and recognition; men who petition God rather than position themselves. The state of the family today is disheartening. Men have largely forsaken their God-given role as spiritual leaders in their homesâ€¦that, no one can deny.

sermons.title: Be Ye Doers of the Word
Beware of the Angry Watchmen
sermons.scripture: Song of Solomon 2:1-10, James 1:14, Song of Solomon 5:6-7
sermons.description: October 28, 2007 - There is a false revival on the rise. It is the rise of the angry watchman who will cast stones at those who have gone astray from the Lord. This false revival consists of ministers who have led people away from the truth through legalism and a misguided prosperity gospel. They will forbid and command prodigals not to come into the presence of God until you work your way back into His favor through human effort and religion. We must not remove the veil from the bride of Christ. We have a righteousness that can not be taken away from us because Jesus is our veil.

sermons.title: Double Minded Christians (àª—à«àªœàª°àª¾àª¤à«€ - Gujarati)
sermons.description: Brother Sherebyah speaks on the topic of Double-minded Christians. He speaks most of the message in the Indian language of Gujarati. May we be single-minded towards our Lord and not have any idols and other things which we put in the way. The Lord deserves our 100% for He purchased us with such a great price.

sermons.title: Jesus Training The Twelve
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod powerfully shares on Jesus training the twelve disciples showing all the ways Jesus trained them. He shares many lessons for our walk with Jesus Christ daily in our day. Are you seeing your need before God today? For the Holy Spirit with prevailing prayer?

sermons.title: Jesus Training The Twelve (full service)
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod powerfully shares on Jesus training the twelve disciples showing all the ways Jesus trained them. He shares many lessons for our walk with Jesus Christ daily in our day. Are you seeing your need before God today? For the Holy Spirit with prevailing prayer?

sermons.title: Murmuring Against One Another
sermons.description: Alan Martin shares from a deep burden of seeing brothers yield to murmuring against one another.  This is such a plague in the body of Christ. It is unsettling to see so many lifes shipwrecked by carnal and critical words. Where is the fear of God like David had, where we pray "Lord put a watch over my mouth, and keep the door of my lips."  May the fear of the Lord come upon us all.

sermons.title: Preparing Your Heart to Receive the Truth
sermons.description: It is shared in this sermon that we need to take the time to prepare our hearts to receive the truth of God. The preparation is from God in proverbs, and yet it says sow to yourselves righteousness and break up your fallow ground. This sermon covers the need for people to have their hearts prepared to receive the truth to come into vital relationship with God.

sermons.title: The Blessing of Obedience
sermons.description: We all have some area that we struggle with, but there is a blessing to obeying Jesus. Ephesians 1:17; James 1:22-25; Psalm 119:145-146

sermons.title: The Call For Multiplying House Churches
sermons.description: Brother E.A. Abraham shares his testimony of being fruitless in ministry for 10 years and then the Lord started to do the work seeing thousands come to the Lord in Bihar, India. He encourages house churches in the West to share the Gospel and see house churches multiply and disciples made. He speaks on James 1:22 that we need to obey the Lord and the great commission.

sermons.title: The Great Need Of Revival by Denny Kenaston
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston opens the revival conference with a exhortation to seek the face of God, to see what God can do! He shares the burden and reason why revival is very needful in our day. Then he preaches verse by verse through psalm 80 asking God to restore his church to God.

sermons.title: The Purpose of Trials
sermons.description: A message that explores the primary reason why God allows different fiery trials and temptations to afflict a saint. Learn how to prepare for tests and progress in the school of God. The preacher seeks to communicate the deep practicality of God's refining process in the hearts of His people.
